Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic funerary text on recto only (12 columns). Cut and mounted in three frames.
Curator's comments: Published: Mark Smith, The MortuaryTexts of Papyrus BM 10507 (London 1987). Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Religious text written for Hor son of Petemin. Date. Late Ptolemaic or Early Roman". Translation: Mark Smith, Traversing Eternity; Texts for the Afterlife from Ptolemaic and Roman Egypt (Oxford 2009), text no. 12. Mosher, Catalogue of the Books of the Dead in the BM: The Papyrus of Hor, (2001), p.35 n.16. Cfr. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Cfr. Hoffmann F., Das Alter des Hor, Sohnes des Petemin, in P. BM EA 10507 2.3, in S.L. Lippert and M.A. Stadler (eds.), Gehilfe des Thot : Festschrift für Karl-Theodor Zauzich zu seinem 75. Geburtstag. Wiesbaden, 2014, 51-53. Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 321.
Bibliographic references: Smith 1987 / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum III: The Mortuary Texts of Papyrus BM 10507
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (48654) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/48654)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: cockled, delaminating, fractured, loss Black ink Backed: brown paper (cockled) Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: leather (deteriorated) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
Acquisition date: 1896 (Purchased by E.A.T.W Budge in Akhmim, Egypt)
